main event: A UFO sighting report from June 9, 1949, in Tioga, Colorado, involved the observation of five unknown objects flying in formation at a high speed of 500-600 mph at an altitude of 20,000 feet.
interesting points: The observer described the objects as disc-shaped and believed they were disc-shaped due to the high altitude making it difficult to determine their shape.
The objects flew in two echelons, with two flying parallel to each other followed by three more which changed positions in a triangular pattern.
No evidence of any trail or exhaust was observed, and there was no sound associated with these objects.
The possibility of the objects being a cluster of comets or upper air research balloons was considered.
Despite the high speed and altitude, the observer, a farmhand, remained level-headed and calm during the sighting.
result: Balloons or comets were suggested as a potential explanation, but the report remains unexplained due to the lack of definitive evidence or explanation for the observed objects.
sighted object: Five unknown objects flying in formation at high speeds at an estimated altitude of 20,000 feet
witnesses: The observer was a farmhand who was considered to be reliable and level-headed.
photographs: No photographs were included in the report.
